content:
👋 Hello, I’m Mouad Assargual I’m a Master’s student in Artificial Intelligence and a digital entrepreneur. I help ambitious brands, creators, and public figures grow their digital presence with modern strategies rooted in AI, branding, and storytelling.
🎯 What Drives Me “The future belongs to those who combine creativity with technology.”
My mission is to bridge the gap between innovation and impact — by helping people leverage digital tools to build brands that matter.
💼 Who I Work With Tech startups launching their first product Entrepreneurs building personal brands Public figures modernizing their digital image Institutions exploring digital transformation 🧠 My Skills AI & Data Science: Python, TensorFlow, scikit-learn Web: Hugo, GitHub Pages, Figma Digital Strategy: Branding, content systems, social media growth Productivity: Notion, Todoist, time-blocking, automation 🚀 Outside of Work I love learning, mentoring, building side-projects, and helping others unlock their digital potential. Let’s grow together.

title: Projects

content:
Starting Young: Ambition vs Reality Being in your 20s means energy, curiosity — and confusion. I launched my first digital consulting business while pursuing an AI Master’s degree. Here’s what that looked like.
What I Got Wrong (at First) Trying to do everything solo Undervaluing deep work Chasing clients instead of clarity What Changed My Game Clear service positioning Systems (like Notion, Todoist, and automation) Reframing “failure” as feedback Advice for Other Young Entrepreneurs Start messy. Learn fast. Focus on value and leverage — not hustle and noise.
summary:
Starting Young: Ambition vs Reality

Being in your 20s means energy, curiosity — and confusion. I launched my first digital consulting business while pursuing an AI Master’s degree. Here’s what that looked like.

What I Got Wrong (at First)

  • Trying to do everything solo
  • Undervaluing deep work
  • Chasing clients instead of clarity

What Changed My Game

  • Clear service positioning
  • Systems (like Notion, Todoist, and automation)
  • Reframing “failure” as feedback

Advice for Other Young Entrepreneurs

Start messy. Learn fast. Focus on value and leverage — not hustle and noise.
title: Lessons from Being a 21-Year-Old Entrepreneur While Studying AI

content:
Balancing a Master’s in AI and running a digital business is intense—but possible.
Here are 3 things that help me:
Time blocking with Google Calendar Project management with Notion + Todoist Prioritizing deep work over busy work
summary:
Balancing a Master’s in AI and running a digital business is intense—but possible.

Here are 3 things that help me:

  1. Time blocking with Google Calendar
  2. Project management with Notion + Todoist
  3. Prioritizing deep work over busy work
title: How I Manage My Time as a Student Entrepreneur

content:
The Myth of Doing More Productivity isn’t about hustle. It’s about intentional execution. Systems help eliminate the noise so you can focus on meaningful progress.
My Stack Notion → Projects, CRM, content plans
Todoist → Daily execution
Google Calendar → Time blocking
Why It Works Each tool serves a purpose:
Capture everything once
Organize by outcome
Execute without stress
If you’re overwhelmed, it’s not your fault — it’s your system.
summary:

title: Why I’m Obsessed with Productivity Systems (and You Should Be Too)

content:
Here are the tools I rely on daily to run my business and content systems:
Notion — project management, documentation, CRM Todoist — daily task execution and deadlines Google Calendar — time blocking and focus scheduling Figma — quick design and visual planning GitHub + Hugo — for my blog and static sites ChatGPT — ideation, writing, and automation assistant
summary:
Here are the tools I rely on daily to run my business and content systems:

  • Notion — project management, documentation, CRM
  • Todoist — daily task execution and deadlines
  • Google Calendar — time blocking and focus scheduling
  • Figma — quick design and visual planning
  • GitHub + Hugo — for my blog and static sites
  • ChatGPT — ideation, writing, and automation assistant
title: Tools I Use to Run My Business

content:
Introduction: Why This Website Exists In a world of fleeting social media platforms, owning your own website is one of the smartest moves you can make for long-term growth. This blog explains why I built this website from scratch using Hugo and PaperMod, and why you should consider doing the same.
The Problem with Relying on Social Media Platforms change their rules, algorithms shift, and audiences scatter. That’s risky. Your personal site is a digital asset you control.
What This Website Will Be This is my digital HQ — a place to:
Share insights on AI, productivity, and entrepreneurship Document real projects and transformation Build trust through transparency
summary:
Introduction: Why This Website Exists

In a world of fleeting social media platforms, owning your own website is one of the smartest moves you can make for long-term growth. This blog explains why I built this website from scratch using Hugo and PaperMod, and why you should consider doing the same.
title: Why I Created This Website: Building a Digital Home for My Personal Brand
